pullRequest.body:
Add a GitHub action triggered on the `!bench` comments.

Reports a summary of the changes by at least 10^9 instructions.

[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/bench.20summaries)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [860604bbe2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16488/commits/860604bbe23118107e05ee45f874d694c0c48db7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Bench`
`+ addBenchSummaryComment`
`+ benchOutput`
`+ formatDiff`
`+ formatFile`
`+ formatPercent`
`+ intDecs`
`+ summary`
`+ toCollapsibleTable`
`+ toTable`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks for writing this and slowly automating Michael Stoll's manual comments! This looks very useful!

I took a look up to line 100 of `bench_summary`. Here's my usual bunch of persnickety comments.

Thanks for writing this and slowly automating Michael Stoll's manual comments! This looks very useful!

I took a look up to line 100 of `bench_summary`. Here's my usual bunch of persnickety comments.
Michael, thank you for the review: I implemented all your comments!
If I remember #16241 correctly, you should remove the `!= null` part.
Removed `!= null`.

WDYT?
```suggestion
    name: Post summary of benchmarking results
Looks good, thanks!

"~" is (AFAIK) a UNIX-ism that not everybody might understand. Is this supposed to be an absolute "path" ("My.Deep-Directories.Nesting.Mathlib.Path.To.File") or more like "Mathlib.Path.To.File"? If the latter, I would just remove the tilde.

This is just the format in which the speedcenter returns paths: `Mathlib.X...` is returned as `~Mathlib.X...`, while `build` and `lint` are returned without the `~`.

I later strip that off with `.dropWhile (!.isAlpha)`.

```suggestion
It writes the number as `x.y * 10 ^ exp`, where `y` has `prec` digits and returns

```suggestion
/-- Convert a `Float` into a formatted string of the form `z.w%`. -/
Small detail: you don't need the parens anymore, right?
If you want, you could inline `sgnf`. (I don't know Lean's coercion rules well: can you multiply sgn and reldiff directly? If so, you could perhaps even remove it.)
Inlining works and I did it. Heterogeneous multiplication does not, though.
Great idea to add a test!
Would you like to also test `formatDiff` (can be with the same data)?
Added a test of `formatDiff` as well.
My brain gave up trying to mentally parse the "`` `file``". I'll trust you go this right; it's for documentation only anyway.
You are right that there was a bug: the input string is enclosed in backticks for md-formatting.
"into a markdown table"?

I'm assuming this can be deleted?
```suggestion
```

Actually, line28 of the workflow 

```
          sed "s=--\(run_cmd .*\) putPR=\1 ${PR}=" scripts/bench_summary.lean |
```

uncomments this line and makes it live in CI.

Oh wow! It would be good to have a normal comment above this line explaining this.

**edit** And maybe it should be mentioned in the module docstring as well, since this is a rather nonstandard way of interacting with a lean file...

I modified the workflow, by both, adding a comment in the file, but also changing the `sed` line to a "`cat` + `printf`" pair that *adds* the extra line, rather than uncommenting the one present in the file.

pullRequest.title: feat(CI): add summary of benchmarking output
